with an introductory note by Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco.
Translations in verse, by the Countess Martinengo Cesaresco.
edited by Evelyn M. Carrington ; sponsored by American Association of University Women, Austin Branch.
edited by Evelyn M. Carrington ; with a new introduction by Debbie Mauldin Cottrell.
The Fred H. and Ella Mae Moore Texas history reprint series ;

"Published ... in cooperation with the Center for Studies in Texas History at the University of Texas at Austin"--T.p. verso.

Italian characters in the epoch of unification,
by the Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco.
Italian characters in the epoch of unification
(Patriotti italiani) by the Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco.
Sigismondo Castromediano.--Bettino Ricasoli.--Luigi Settembrini.--Giuseppe Martinengo.--Daniele Manin.--The Poerios.--Constance d'Azeglio.--Goffredo Mameli.--Ugo Bassi.--Nino Bixio.--The Cairolis.

This is an edited, reformatted and augmented version of "The Liberation of Italy, 1815-1870" by The Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco, published by Seely and Co, Limited Essex Street, London , in 1895--Preface.
by the countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco ; with illustrations.

Benacus, the poets' lake -- Memorials of a Lombard house [i.e. the Martinengo family] -- Vittoria Accoramboni -- In the Francia-corta -- The Lake of Iseo -- Lombard agriculture -- Arthur Young's north Italian journey -- Rimini to-day -- Historical Rimini -- The popular stage -- La Scala.
Forms part of the personal library materials in the Joseph and Elizabeth Robins Pennell Collection.
Pennell (STORED OFF SITE - advance notice needed)
The outdoor life in Greek and Roman Poets, and kindred studies,
by the Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco.
"The chapters were published separately in the Contemporary review."

The peasant of ancient Greece.--Husbandry in the Greek dramatists.--The Attic homestead.--The last Greek peasant.--Nature in the earlier Roman poets.--A prose source of the Georgics.--Virgil in the country.--Tibullus at his farm.--Ovid and the natural world.--The Roman's villeggiatura.--Nature in the last Latin poets.--Transformation.--The divine pastoral.--Puer parvulus.--The modern pastoral in Italy.
The place of animals in human thought,
by the Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco ...
Reprinted, in part, from the Contemporary review. cf. Pref.

Preface. -- I. Soul-wandering as it concerns animals. -- II. The Greek conception of animals. -- III. Animals at Rome. -- IV. Plutarch the humane. -- V. Man and his brother. -- VI. The faith of Iran. -- VII. Zoroastrian zoology. -- VIII. A religon of ruth. -- IX. Lines from the Adi Granth. -- X. The Hebrew conception of animals. -- XI. "A people like unto you." -- XII. The friend of the creature. XIII. Versipelles. -- XIV. The horse as hero. -- XV. Animals in Eastern fiction. -- XVI. The growth of modern ideas about animals. -- Index.
Glimpses of Italian society in the eighteenth century.
From the 'Journey' of Mrs. Piozzi, with an introduction by the Countess Evelyn Martinengo Cesaresco.
From the author's "Obervations and reflections made in the course of a journey through France, Italy, and Germany," first published London, 1789.
